Model UN Team Wins - 8 Years in a Row!

The CHS Model UN team recently attended the National High School Model UN conference in New York City from March 4th-7th. For the eighth straight year in a row, the team of 52 students was awarded the "Award for Generosity and Unmatched Service Learning." This year's service learning project was "Freedom of the Press Foundation" which seeks to protect journalists by launching advocacy campaigns supporting the rights of journalists and providing digital tools to help them operate safely around the world.

Carlisle Indoor Track & Field qualifies relays and individuals for the National Championships!

Carlisle girls have had a winter full of record-breaking performances. On Sunday, March 1st the Distance Medley Relay (pictured) placed 3rd at the State Championships and qualified for the National Championship meet held March 13th-15th at the Armory in New York City. From left to right pictured are Savannah Hossfeld, Sophia Toti, Sophie Salomone, and Alyssa Dyson. They ran 12:13.21 to break the previous school record by 20 seconds! Rileigh Cardin will be competing in Pole Vault and Sophia Toti will also run an individual event at the National Championship meet, but which one has not yet been determined. Sophia is qualified to run the mile, 2 mile, AND 5000m races!

Pennsylvania's Secretary of Education, Pedro Rivera, participated in an event at Carlisle Area School District!

Business and Education Leaders visited Carlisle Area School District's Center for Careers and Technology program to highlight the importance of career and technical education in solving Pennsylvania's workforce shortages.

The Honorable Pedro Rivera, Secretary of Education, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, State Representative Barbara Gleim; State Representative Torren Ecker; Dr. Albert Parrillo, Director of Careers and Technology Education, Carlisle Area School District; Carlisle students Brooke Blackledge and Xander Pechart; Michelle Lisk, a Carlisle Area Chamber of Commerce Board member and CEO of SYNERGY HomeCare Mid Penn; and Denise Garman, Manager of Community Relations and Volunteers at UPMC Carlisle Hospital and member of the school district’s Occupational Advisory Committee participated in the event organized by Ready Nation Council for a Strong America.

Lieutenant Colonel (LTC) Torrie Jackson, Jr. a current student at the Army War College recently spoke to the 9th Grade Class at CHS. LTC Jackson is a native of Jackson, MS. He holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science and Master of Arts degree in Educational Administration, both from Jackson State University. In his civilian capacity, LTC Jackson serves as a school administrator for the Holmes County Consolidated School District, located in Lexington, MS and holds the rank of Lieutenant with the Hinds County Sheriff’s Office Reserve Division in Jackson, MS.

The message LTC Jackson delivered to the students was powerful. He spoke to the students on the 5 C’s – Courage, Competence, Confidence, Candor, and Commitment. As the character traits were presented he interacted with the students, which allowed the students to gain a better understanding.

CHS appreciated the opportunity to host LTC Jackson and the message which was delivered to approximately 425 students.

Kevin Wagner was one of three teachers in the nation to be recognized by the Veterans of Foreign Wars of the U.S. in the summer of 2019 for their "outstanding commitment to teach Americanism and patriotism to their students.”

Wagner, who teaches AP US History and AP Research, was awarded the VFW’s 2019 Smart/Maher VFW National Citizenship Education Teacher Award.

Wagner was chosen for his dedication to honoring the memory of America’s veterans through his “Silent Heroes” project, where students preserve the legacy of a local World War II veteran killed at Normandy by creating a webpage that explores the veteran’s life and service.

The project expanded last year to identify local Vietnam War veterans, which led to the construction of a Vietnam Wall of Honor. The wall displays the names of more than 213 veterans and flag cases honoring 10 former students killed during the war.

VFW Post 477 and its Auxiliary in Carlisle sponsored Wagner.

Pictured with Kevin are Richard Olson, Commander of Post 447, Wayne Perry, VFW State Commander, and high school principal Dr. Michael Black.

AP Research teacher, Ellie Park, alongside senior Lillian Sweeney and junior Caitlin Fay presented at the Rotary Luncheon on May 9th. Lillian presented her final paper, “Language and the Pennsylvania ‘LGBT’ Community: A History, Analysis, and Discussion of the Future,” which examined the sociolinguistic impact of language, labels, and slurs on the LGBT community in central Pennsylvania.

CASD Art Department’s National Art Honors Society has been recognized as a Shippensburg University School Study Council Exemplary Program. The Carlisle Area School District Art Department and the National Art Honors Society promotes community arts partnerships that includes educators, students, parents, and the community; who work together to increase opportunities that will enhance both the community and student's learning about the arts and appreciation for the arts.

This group of students accomplished these objectives by developing an Empty Bowls program to support our local food bank, hosting an artist in residence at Carlisle High School to create a mural in downtown Carlisle, and by partnering with multiple community organizations to provide art experiences to our community.

Pictured are Carlisle High School Principal Dr. Michael Black, Director of Curriculum and Instruction Michael Gogoj, Shippensburg University Associate Professor Dr. Diller, Art & Design Program Chair Ashley Gogoj, Student Representatives Hailey Myers and Jacob Brenner, and NAHS Advisor Rachel Drumheller.

CASD participants include, from left to right: Kai Clements (WMS, 6th grade), Megan Hupfer (WMS band director), Evelyn Duque (LMS, 8th grade), Nolan Snyder (CES, 5th grade), Blaine Stoner (LMS, 8th grade), and Becky Weaver (elementary band director). Crestview’s Nolan Snyder received special recognition for being the youngest participant! Performers ranged in age from 10 to 67.
